data.original: We propose a fully differentiable module based on monotonic rational quadratic splines, which enhances the flexibility of both coupling and autoregressive transforms while retaining analytic invertibility.
data.summary: Introduced a new module using monotonic rational quadratic splines that increases model flexibility and maintains analytical invertibility.

data.original: We demonstrate that neural spline flows improve density estimation, variational inference, and generative modeling of images.
data.summary: Showed empirical improvements in density estimation, variational inference, and image generation using neural spline flows.

data.original: The module acts as a drop-in replacement for the affine or additive transformations commonly found in coupling and autoregressive transforms.
data.summary: Provided a direct replacement for existing transformations in coupling and autoregressive models, enhancing their capabilities without altering the overall architecture.

data.original: Monotonic rational quadratic splines naturally induce multi-modality when used to transform random variables.
data.summary: Highlighted the ability of the proposed splines to introduce multi-modality in transformed distributions, improving the model's representational power.
